title: Hebrews: Better Covenant
objective: Understand Jesus' once-for-all sacrifice and the call to endure in faith.

required_passages.text: You are a priest forever... We have this as a sure and steadfast anchor of the soul... Christ entered once for all... by means of his own blood... Let us hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering.

segments.audio_script: Hebrews now contrasts repeated sacrifices with Christ's once-for-all atonement.

Listen to Hebrews 5-10. Jesus is the eternal priest in the order of Melchizedek. The writer warns against spiritual immaturity and urges diligence in hope. Christ mediates a better covenant with better promises. His sacrifice is final and sufficient, cleansing conscience and opening true access to God. Believers are urged not to shrink back but to endure in faith.
The audience was weary and vulnerable to returning to temple-centered security.
If Christ's sacrifice is complete, no further offering is needed. Confidence before God rests on Jesus, not repeated rituals. Perseverance flows from certainty in His finished work.
Key themes include better covenant, once-for-all sacrifice, cleansed conscience, assurance, perseverance, and warning against apostasy.
Reflect on this: Are you living from Christ's finished work, or returning to self-made spiritual efforts?
Jesus secures full access to God forever. Next, Hebrews celebrates faith's endurance and practical holiness.
